au.edu.rmit.cpt222.model.interfaces

Interface GameEngine


  • public interface GameEngine
    Assignment interface (facade) for SADI providing main model functionality
    Author:
    Mikhail Perepletchikov and Caspar Ryan

        static final int NUM_OF_COINS
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • addGameEngineCallback

        void addGameEngineCallback(GameEngineCallback gameEngineCallback)
        Adds new GameEngineCallback to the GameEngine
        Parameters:
        gameEngineCallback - a client specific implementation of GameEngineCallback used to perform display updates etc. you will use a different implementation of the GameEngineCallback for GUI and console versions

      • addPlayer

        void addPlayer(Player player)
        Adds a Player to the game
        Parameters:
        player - Player object to add to the game

      • calculateResult

        void calculateResult()
        This method goes through all players and applies win/loss/draw outcome to update betting points. GameEngineCallback#gameResult(Player, GameStatus, GameEngine) should also be called with final result for each player. NOTE: you don't have to call this method from the client. Instead, it can be called internally from the flip(int, int).
        See Also:
        GameEngineCallback

      • flip

        void flip(int flipDelay,
          int coinDelay)
        Flip the coins 1. flip a coin random number of times; 2. call GameEngineCallback.coinFlip(Coin.Face, GameEngine) while the coin is spinning; 3. call GameEngineCallback.coinFlipOutcome(int, Coin.Face, GameEngine) when the coin has stopped spinning; 4. continue to perform coin flip with a new coin until all coins have been "flipped"; 5. call calculateResult(). NOTES: - the value for number of coins to be "flipped" can be supplied by the client during GameEngineImpl initialisation. - if this number is not provided, the default GameEngine.NUM_OF_COINS value should be used instead. - the client must make sure that the provided number of coins value is even.
        Parameters:
        flipDelay - the delay between each coin "spin" in milliseconds
        coinDelay - the delay between the coin change in milliseconds
        See Also:
        GameEngineCallback

      • getAllPlayers

        java.util.Collection<Player> getAllPlayers()
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection of all Players
        See Also:
        Player

      • getPlayer

        Player getPlayer(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves a Player indicated by the provided id
        Parameters:
        id - id of the Player to retrieve (should return null if not found)
        Returns:
        Player object

      • placeBet

        void placeBet(Player player,
              Coin.Face face,
              int bet)
       throws InsufficientFundsException
        The implementation should forward the call to the Player entity which will be responsible for checking if this player has sufficient points to place the bet
        Parameters:
        player - betting Player
        face - the chosen coin face
        bet - the bet in points
        Throws:
        InsufficientFundsException - if the player has insufficient points and the bet cannot be placed

      • removeGameEngineCallback

        void removeGameEngineCallback(GameEngineCallback gameEngineCallback)
        Removes a callback associated with the player (when a player quits the game) to remove no longer needed UI updates TODO (no need to implement in Ass1)
        Parameters:
        gameEngineCallback - a client specific implementation of GameEngineCallback to be removed from the game. NOTE: to be used in Assignment 2

      • removePlayer

        boolean removePlayer(Player player)
        Removes a given Player from the game.
        Parameters:
        player - reference to the Player to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the player existed

      • setPlayerPoints

        void setPlayerPoints(Player player,
                     int totalPoints)
        Sets player's (credit) points to the provided value.
        Parameters:
        player - reference to the Player to be updated with new points
        totalPoints - sets player points balance (total points)
